alert.note: Alert for Lowndes; Noxubee; Oktibbeha; Winston (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 6:05PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Noxubee, southeastern Oktibbeha, northeastern Winston and southwestern Lowndes Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 605 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Starkville to near Longview to near Craig Springs. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Craig Springs around 610 PM CDT. Sessums around 615 PM CDT. Oktoc around 620 PM CDT. Betheden around 625 PM CDT. Millcreek around 635 PM CDT. Crawford around 640 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Artesia and Sturgis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
